arch:property.oc:show_val: Sandy soil and bedrock, although the bedrock has as yet to be confirmed.

The Locus 4 Rock Formation in the center east, the Locus 5 Wall extending from the West Balk to the East Wall, the Locus 6 North south Terrace Wall, which bonds with Loci 5 and 7, Locus 7 east west Terrace Wall bonding with Loci 6 and 4, and the Locus 8 Water Channel Canalization.
These canalization walls are 3.65 m in length and are one ashlar wide or approximately 0.32 m in width per wall. They are 0.42 m in distance from one another.
Inner edge of the northern part of this wall that extends parallel to the canalization system — 1.54 m from Trench Datum Point B.
Parallel walls enclosing the water canalization system of Locus 8

This canalization system is built on top of an artificial platform next to the Locus 3 East Perimeter Wall. This water Canalization System appears as if it is a later manipulation of the water that was held further south in the Reservoir in Locus 19, but at this point there is no physical connection that can be seen to connect them.
